result.execSummary:
The defendant AMY L. RIVERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
With huber if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report, IN PERSON, to the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, after sentencing with a completed GPS application and to arrange a report date.  TO BEGIN SERVING SENTENCE WITHIN 60 DAYS.   Failure to report to jail/huber shall result in loss of work release privileges and a warrant shall be authorized.

FURTHER ORDER:  If Defendant can get into in-patient treatment and can provide written information from that treatment facility to the jail before the report date, Defendant will receive credit and the remainder of the sentence shall be stayed upon successful completion of treatment.  If Defendant leaves treatment and is not successfully discharged, the remainder of the 6 months shall be imposed  If Defendant is unable to get into in-patient treatment before her report date, the full 6 months shall be imposed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 9:16 AM Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Offer/agreement placed onto court record.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Atty Ulrich argues conditional jail be stayed.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Findings made, sentencing by the court.  Parties waive right to PreSentence Investigation Report.
Comstock form

10:46 AM Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court.  Margaret Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Failure to appear by DEF for a known hearing.  Court authorizes issuance of a bench warrant.
RECALLED 10:56 AM  Defendant appears late.  All appearances remain the same.  Court quashes bench warrant and reinstates bond.  Parties request adjournment of plea/sentencing hearing.  Request granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:43 AM Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests jury trial be removed from the calendar and adjourn.  Requests plea and sentencing date about 30 days out.  No objection from the State.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Jury Trial

09:12 AM Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:04 AM Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:07.  Arraignment scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
signed on 02-02-2022
Attorney Ulrich

03:00 PM Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in court with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Defendant AMY L. RIVERS in custody WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL.  Nerrissa L Dyett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AMY L. RIVERS appeared by video means with Attorney.  Has complaint - advised of charges and potential penalties.
